heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.9°C) and outside temperature (up 3.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%) and rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 604 m) and light levels (up 2851 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1008 m) and light levels (up 6599 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 604.2m lower than yesterday, 862.0m lower than the past week, 1008.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 760m to a maximum of 2130m, averaging 727.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1589.3m and 1735.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 5.3°C higher than yesterday, 6.3°C higher than the past week, 34.6°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s dew point temperatures showed a low of 2.6°C and a peak of 14.1°C, averaging 14.9°C; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

Today’s average feels like temperature is 4.9°C higher than yesterday, 5.8°C higher than the past week, 37.0°C lower than the past month.

The feels like temperatures yesterday fell between 1.8°C minimum and 17.6°C maximum, with an average of 15.2°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 9.5°C and 52.2°C.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, very clammy and humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, fog or low cloud is expected, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
